action.action-desc: Ms. Ernst (for herself, Mr. Budd, Mrs. Britt, Mr. Cruz, Mr. Lankford, Mr. Scott of Florida, Mrs. Hyde-Smith, and Mr. Hagerty) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend title 18, United States Code, to punish the distribution of fentanyl resulting in death as felony murder.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Felony Murder for Deadly Fentanyl Distribution Act of 2025.

section.header: Fentanyl distribution resulting in death punished as felony murder
section.text: Section 1111 of title 18, United States Code, is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a), in the second sentence, by inserting , distributing fentanyl after child abuse;

subparagraph.text: by striking (b) Within and inserting (b)(1) Within; and
by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: Whoever is guilty of murder in the first degree by distributing fentanyl shall be punished by death or by imprisonment for life.

subparagraph.text: by redesignating paragraphs (4) through (6) as paragraphs (6) through (8), respectively; and
by inserting after paragraph (3) the following:

paragraph.text: the terms controlled substance and distribute have the meanings given the terms in section 102 of the Controlled Substances Act (21 U.S.C. 802);
distributing fentanyl means to distribute a controlled substance—

subparagraph.text: involving 2 grams or more of a mixture or substance containing a detectable amount of N-phenyl-N-[1-(2-phenylethyl)-4-piperidinyl] propanamide or .5 grams or more of a mixture or substance containing a detectable amount of any analogue of N-phenyl-N-[1-(2-phenylethyl)-4-piperidinyl] propanamide;
that results in death from the use of a mixture or substance described in subparagraph (A); and
knowing or having reason to know that the controlled substance contains a detectable amount of a mixture or substance described in subparagraph (A).
